snippet: The country’s patent laws are conducive to blocking competitors while legal skirmishes play out in the courtroom.
abstract: Microsoft's decision to move its European logistics and distribution headquarters to the Netherlands from Germany spurs debate over patent law in Germany, where it is easy to block the sale of a rival's product even before an infringement claim is played out in court; patent lawsuits in Germany among technology companies are increasing, often claiming violations of patents of globally recognized technology standards and seeking to exploit the German system for strategic advantage.
lead_paragraph: The country’s patent laws are conducive to blocking competitors while legal skirmishes play out in the courtroom.

headline.seo: German Courts at Center of Tech Rivals’ Patent Fights
headline.main: German Courts at Epicenter of Global Patent Battles Among Tech Rivals
headline.print_headline: German Courts at Epicenter of Global Patent Battles Among Tech Rivals
